data.title: Timer autostart not working
data.body: Add a Timer, set a timeout value, set it to one-shot, set it to autostart, connect the timeout event to a function... Function never gets called.

data.title: Editor fix for Apple keyboards
data.body:
Fix for the [] and {} Keyboard bug on Apple Keyboards, also changing
the short cuts for file saving and tabbing to CMD + ... instead of ALT +
â€¦

data.title: get_total_character_count() returns incorrect count
data.body:
Label.get_total_character_count() is returning a higher count than it should.

To test, add a label, set set some text like 1234567890 (10 characters). Print out the total, and you get 12... Wrong.

data.title: Port manual to FLOSS Manuals?
data.body:
Hi all,
What are your thoughts on providing a Godot manual through the FLOSS Manuals platform? I am available to help with the project :-)
--Brylie

data.title: Collision layers don't work in 3d
data.body:
I tried to put different physicsbodies in different collision layers so they wouldn't collide, but they still did.
I used different mask pairs, changed the masks both in the editor and by script and tried rigid-rigid and rigid-static body pairs, but they all collided.
This only applies to 3d, in 2d it works.

data.title: Godot editor accepts non-ascii chars but doesn't show them
data.body: As a result, there might be invisible unknown characters in the code

data.title: Fix compilation error on 32-bit linux
data.body: There was an error compiling on 32-bit (Arch) Linux.

data.title: Framebuffer objects
data.body:
(This was given greenlight in #862 but I think it's a good thing to have a separate issue for this; reduz said they will arrive in 1.1 or 1.2)

Framebuffer objects ([render textures](http://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/class-RenderTexture.html) in Unity) are essential for many effects (including all effects that require depth and/or normal textures) like [this](http://http.developer.nvidia.com/GPUGems2/gpugems2_chapter09.html) or [this](http://willychyr.com/2013/11/unity-shaders-depth-and-normal-textures/).

In my case, I'm trying to reproduce Example 9-2 described [here](http://http.developer.nvidia.com/GPUGems2/gpugems2_chapter09.html) BTW.

data.title: Increment ranges while mouse held down.
data.body:
It would be great for all of the arrows on ranges in the property inspector to increment rapidly if the mouse click is held down for more than a certain threshold (half second?).

Two other related suggestions that may make sense: allow mouse wheel scroll to increment/decrement a range, and/or the up/down arrows to do the same when a range is selected.

Having to mouse click for every increment is sometimes a little tedious.

data.title: add sane radius increment to CircleShape2D
data.body: closes #866

data.title: Collision shape scale increments to slow
data.body:
Really small problem here but when in the resource editor for a collision shape the scale option increments at 0.01 units per click. This is way too little and takes far to many clicks to see a noticeable difference. It would be far more useful if it incremented at ~0.5.

Image showing the panel:

![screenshot from 2014-11-08 14 54 10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6601505/4963498/0f274782-6717-11e4-83c4-16363b73349b.png)

data.title: disable alt+arrows to move cursor in text editor
data.body:
This disables cursor movement via arrow keys in text editor when Alt key is held down.

This will allow Alt+Up/Down to be mapped to moving selected lines up/down, and Alt+Left/Right to indent/unindent selected lines like other code editors have, and which DCubix was implementing in #825

data.title: [deleted]
data.body: [deleted]

data.title: Fix CppCheck 'duplicateExpression' warning
data.body:
BTW, all three cases looks similar. It would be nice to refactor it
to avoid repeating code.

data.title: Shader passes
data.body:
There are many effects that require multiple passes, each time with a different shader, either finally combining the outputs into a final one, or using the output of one pass as input to the next one.

A lot of 3D engines out there supports this in some form. Unity has the concept of [Pass](http://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/ShaderTut2.html).

Right now, it is impossible to do multiple passes with godot, so we are restricted to "simple" stuff that can only involve a single pass.
Please add passes to godot!

data.title: Simple geometric objects
data.body:
(from the [forum discussion](http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=1059))

Unity and similar engines have simple objects such as plane/cube/cyclinder/sphere while godot currently lacks them.

Not only it is a huge convenience, but another one up-side is, one can make a 100% 3D godot tutorial similar to [this Unity tutorial](http://unity3d.com/learn/tutorials/projects/roll-a-ball).

data.title: Update cubio.gd
data.body: a little wrong only.

data.title: Script Variables in Inspector is not work when script had extends other script
data.body:
Value that we edit will return to the beginning when we save scene or play the scene.
And if had export variable in a parent script, Script Variables section will be disappear from Inspector when save or play the scene too.

data.title: versioning needs to change before 1.0 stable
data.body: It's said v1.0.3917-beta1 since as long as I can remember. Don't forget to put a new versioning system in place before the 1.0 release!

data.title: Shader fail in overload operators
data.body:
I try to change value for built-in variable, but with no results. For example:
VERTEX *= 0.3; // not work
but
VERTEX.x *= 0.3; // work
VERTEX.y *= 0.3; // work
VERTEX.z *= 0.3; // work

data.title: fixes for release apk export
data.body:
this adds a field for setting the release password on a per-project basis, same as the release keystore and release user. (debug are global options).

this also fixes the release keystore field to not require the keystore be in res://.

closes #850

data.title: Delete key prompts to delete nodes when it shouldn't
data.body: If you select all from the menu or hotkey, and then try to cut the text it to the clipboard or delete it with backspace or Del, it doesn't work.

data.title: add timestamping authority server option for Android
data.body: This adds an option for specifying a TSA URL which will timestamp Android APK exports when signing with jarsigner. Tested with http://tsa.safecreative.org/ as an example on OpenJDK7 jarsigner on Debian Jessie.

data.title: add option to auto-scan a directory for projects
data.body:
This adds an option to allow the Project Manager to auto-scan a certain directory once at startup.

Saves having to scan every time new Godot demos are added, for example.

data.title: fixes default project dir option
data.body:
Currently, if you set a default project directory in the editor prefs, it works fine when you launch Godot.

But if you open a project, then quit back to the Project Manager, it no longer respects the default directory preference for the Create or Import options (Scan option was working correctly, however).

This one-liner patch fixes it for Create and Import dialogs, as I had originally intended.

data.title: can't set android release keystore password
data.body: To export a release apk, the jarsigner needs the password for the release keystore that we generate.  There's nowhere to enter this, so the jarsigner errors due to the wrong password, and export fails.

data.title: Region editor for Sprite2D
data.body: A visual editor similar to the UV editor would make specifiy regions of textures much faster.

data.title: snap process to fixed process
data.body:
"there should be an option to snap process to fixed process" - reduz (on IRC)

This is related to jittering caused by process and fixed_process being "out of sync"
